data.title: "Weird Al" Yankovic
data.meta_description: The official website of "Weird Al" Yankovic.
data.text:
FEATURE FILM CREDITS

ON SCREEN:

STARRING ROLES:

UHF (1989) – also starring Michael Richards, Fran Drescher, Victoria Jackson, Kevin McCarthy, Anthony Geary, Gedde Wattanabe, Billy Barty, John Paragon, David Bowe, Stanley Brock, Sue Ane Langdon, Trinidad Silva and Emo Philips.

CAMEO & SPECIAL APPEARANCES:

TAPEHEADS (1988) (as Weird Al, trying to avoid John Cusack)

NAKED GUN: FROM THE FILES OF POLICE SQUAD! (1988) (as Weird Al, coming off an airplane)

NAKED GUN 2 1/2: THE SMELL OF FEAR (1991) (as a psychopath, holding O.J. Simpson at gunpoint)

NAKED GUN 33 1/3: THE FINAL INSULT (1994) (as Weird Al, going to the Oscars with Vanna White)

SPY HARD (1996) (singing the theme song on-camera)

SAFETY PATROL (1997) (minor role as himself and performance of original song “The Ballad Of Kent Marlowe”)

DESPERATION BOULEVARD (1998) (a Judy Tenuta film, Al appears as himself)

NOTHING SACRED (2000) (trying on a shirt in a clothing store)

DROPPING OUT (2000) (small cameo as self)

DERAILROADED (2005) (interviewed for documentary

NERDCORE RISING (2008) (interviewed for documentary)

HALLOWEEN II (2009) (Al appears as himself)

CANDYMAN (2010) (interviewed for documentary)

ADVENTURES IN PLYMPTOONS! (2011) (interviewed for documentary)

BATMAN VS. ROBIN (2015) (voice of the Dollmaker)

WRITING:

SPY HARD (wrote opening title sequence)

UHF (co-wrote screenplay with Jay Levey)

DIRECTING:

SPY HARD (directed opening title sequence)

MUSIC:

JOHNNY DANGEROUSLY (wrote and performed title song “This Is The Life”*)

* song was not included on the initial home release on VHS, but appears on the DVD released in 2002

SPY HARD (wrote and performed “Theme From Spy Hard,” heard over opening and closing credits)

TRANSFORMERS: THE MOVIE (Al’s song “Dare To Be Stupid” is featured in a scene)

UHF (wrote and performed several songs, including title song “UHF”)

POKÉMON 2000 THE MOVIE (wrote and performed “Polkamon,” heard over closing credits)
